channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: FeTrIL: Feature Translation for Exemplar-Free Class-Incremental Learning
item.description: Actual features of new classes and pseudo-features of past classes are fed into a linear classifier which is trained incrementally to discriminate between all classes.

item.title: SAH: Shifting-aware Asymmetric Hashing for Reverse $k$-Maximum Inner Product Search
item.description: To speed up the Maximum Inner Product Search (MIPS) on item vectors, we design a shifting-invariant asymmetric transformation and develop a novel sublinear-time Shifting-Aware Asymmetric Locality Sensitive Hashing (SA-ALSH) scheme.

item.title: Subgroup Robustness Grows On Trees: An Empirical Baseline Investigation
item.description: Researchers have proposed many methods for fair and robust machine learning, but comprehensive empirical evaluation of their subgroup robustness is lacking.

item.title: Reliable Robustness Evaluation via Automatically Constructed Attack Ensembles
item.description: Attack Ensemble (AE), which combines multiple attacks together, provides a reliable way to evaluate adversarial robustness.

item.title: SketchBoost: Fast Gradient Boosted Decision Tree for Multioutput Problems
item.description: We are interested in its application to multioutput problems when the output is highly multidimensional.

item.title: A Dynamic Weighted Federated Learning for Android Malware Classification
item.description: In traditional FL, Federated Averaging (FedAvg) is utilized to construct the global model at each round by merging all of the local models obtained from all of the customers that participated in the FL.

item.title: Evaluating Feature Attribution Methods for Electrocardiogram
item.description: The performance of cardiac arrhythmia detection with electrocardiograms(ECGs) has been considerably improved since the introduction of deep learning models.

item.title: GhostNetV2: Enhance Cheap Operation with Long-Range Attention
item.description: The convolutional operation can only capture local information in a window region, which prevents performance from being further improved.

item.title: Unsupervised Unlearning of Concept Drift with Autoencoders
item.description: Specifically, we propose an autoencoder-based method for "unlearning" the concept drift in an unsupervised manner, without having to retrain or adapt any of the learning models operating on the data.

item.title: Contrastive Identity-Aware Learning for Multi-Agent Value Decomposition
item.description: Value Decomposition (VD) aims to deduce the contributions of agents for decentralized policies in the presence of only global rewards, and has recently emerged as a powerful credit assignment paradigm for tackling cooperative Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning (MARL) problems.

item.title: DyRRen: A Dynamic Retriever-Reranker-Generator Model for Numerical Reasoning over Tabular and Textual Data
item.description: Numerical reasoning over hybrid data containing tables and long texts has recently received research attention from the AI community.

item.title: Federated Learning on Non-IID Graphs via Structural Knowledge Sharing
item.description: Inspired by this, we propose FedStar, an FGL framework that extracts and shares the common underlying structure information for inter-graph federated learning tasks.

item.title: NAS-LID: Efficient Neural Architecture Search with Local Intrinsic Dimension
item.description: One-shot neural architecture search (NAS) substantially improves the search efficiency by training one supernet to estimate the performance of every possible child architecture (i. e., subnet).

item.title: DGEKT: A Dual Graph Ensemble Learning Method for Knowledge Tracing
item.description: Knowledge tracing aims to trace students' evolving knowledge states by predicting their future performance on concept-related exercises.

item.title: Masked Autoencoding for Scalable and Generalizable Decision Making
item.description: We are interested in learning scalable agents for reinforcement learning that can learn from large-scale, diverse sequential data similar to current large vision and language models.

item.title: Integrally Pre-Trained Transformer Pyramid Networks
item.description: In this paper, we present an integral pre-training framework based on masked image modeling (MIM).

item.title: This is the way: designing and compiling LEPISZCZE, a comprehensive NLP benchmark for Polish
item.description: In this paper, we introduce LEPISZCZE (the Polish word for glew, the Middle English predecessor of glue), a new, comprehensive benchmark for Polish NLP with a large variety of tasks and high-quality operationalization of the benchmark.

item.title: Latent Video Diffusion Models for High-Fidelity Video Generation with Arbitrary Lengths
item.description: Diffusion models (DMs) are another class of deep generative models and have recently achieved remarkable performance on various image synthesis tasks.

item.title: TransVCL: Attention-enhanced Video Copy Localization Network with Flexible Supervision
item.description: Previous methods typically start from frame-to-frame similarity matrix generated by cosine similarity between frame-level features of the input video pair, and then detect and refine the boundaries of copied segments on similarity matrix under temporal constraints.

item.title: Texts as Images in Prompt Tuning for Multi-Label Image Recognition
item.description: Nonetheless, visual data (e. g., images) is by default prerequisite for learning prompts in existing methods.

item.title: Can lies be faked? Comparing low-stakes and high-stakes deception video datasets from a Machine Learning perspective
item.description: Despite the great impact of lies in human societies and a meager 54% human accuracy for Deception Detection (DD), Machine Learning systems that perform automated DD are still not viable for proper application in real-life settings due to data scarcity.

item.title: SVFormer: Semi-supervised Video Transformer for Action Recognition
item.description: In this paper, we investigate the use of transformer models under the SSL setting for action recognition.

item.title: Automatic Generation of Socratic Subquestions for Teaching Math Word Problems
item.description: On both automatic and human quality evaluations, we find that LMs constrained with desirable question properties generate superior questions and improve the overall performance of a math word problem solver.

item.title: EurNet: Efficient Multi-Range Relational Modeling of Spatial Multi-Relational Data
item.description: We study EurNets in two important domains for image and protein structure modeling.

item.title: TorchScale: Transformers at Scale
item.description: Large Transformers have achieved state-of-the-art performance across many tasks.

item.title: Paint by Example: Exemplar-based Image Editing with Diffusion Models
item.description: Language-guided image editing has achieved great success recently.

item.title: Inversion-Based Creativity Transfer with Diffusion Models
item.description: In this paper, we introduce the task of "Creativity Transfer".

item.title: A Masked Face Classification Benchmark
item.description: Results show that the richness of SF-MASK (real + synthetic images) leads all of the tested classifiers to perform better than exploiting comparative face mask datasets, on a fixed 1077 images testing set.

item.title: Completing point cloud from few points by Wasserstein GAN and Transformers
item.description: Inspired by the successful applications of GAN and Transformers in the image-based vision task, we introduce GAN and Transformer techniques to address the above problem.

item.title: Lite-Mono: A Lightweight CNN and Transformer Architecture for Self-Supervised Monocular Depth Estimation
item.description: Specifically, we investigate the efficient combination of CNNs and Transformers, and design a hybrid architecture Lite-Mono.

item.title: MECCH: Metapath Context Convolution-based Heterogeneous Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Heterogeneous graph neural networks (HGNNs) were proposed for representation learning on structural data with multiple types of nodes and edges.

item.title: Privacy-Enhancing Optical Embeddings for Lensless Classification
item.description: In this work, we enhance the privacy provided by lensless imaging by (1) downsampling at the sensor and (2) using a programmable mask with variable patterns as our optical encoder.

item.title: Breaking the Representation Bottleneck of Chinese Characters: Neural Machine Translation with Stroke Sequence Modeling
item.description: Existing research generally treats Chinese character as a minimum unit for representation.

item.title: Accuracy Prediction for NAS Acceleration using Feature Selection and Extrapolation
item.description: When a candidate architecture has properties that are similar to other known architectures, the prediction task is rather straightforward using off-the-shelf regression algorithms.

item.title: A Cross-Residual Learning for Image Recognition
item.description: ResNets and its variants play an important role in various fields of image recognition.

item.title: SinDiffusion: Learning a Diffusion Model from a Single Natural Image
item.description: We present SinDiffusion, leveraging denoising diffusion models to capture internal distribution of patches from a single natural image.

item.title: HaRiM$^+$: Evaluating Summary Quality with Hallucination Risk
item.description: One of the challenges of developing a summarization model arises from the difficulty in measuring the factual inconsistency of the generated text.

item.title: U-Flow: A U-shaped Normalizing Flow for Anomaly Detection with Unsupervised Threshold
item.description: In this work we propose a non-contrastive method for anomaly detection and segmentation in images, that benefits both from a modern machine learning approach and a more classic statistical detection theory.

item.title: DeepJoin: Learning a Joint Occupancy, Signed Distance, and Normal Field Function for Shape Repair
item.description: We generate a high-resolution restoration shape by inferring a corresponding complete shape and a break surface from an input fractured shape.

item.title: PIC-Score: Probabilistic Interpretable Comparison Score for Optimal Matching Confidence in Single- and Multi-Biometric (Face) Recognition
item.description: In the context of biometrics, matching confidence refers to the confidence that a given matching decision is correct.

item.title: Anatomy-guided domain adaptation for 3D in-bed human pose estimation
item.description: As a remedy, we present a novel domain adaptation method, adapting a model from a labeled source to a shifted unlabeled target domain.

item.title: Predicting the Type and Target of Offensive Social Media Posts in Marathi
item.description: We introduce the Marathi Offensive Language Dataset v. 2. 0 or MOLD 2. 0 and present multiple experiments on this dataset.

item.title: Mapping City-Wide Perceptions of Neighbourhood Quality using Street View Images
item.description: Researchers demonstrated the efficacy of crowd-sourcing perception ratings of image pairs across 56 cities and training a model to predict perceptions from street-view images.

item.title: Big Earth Data and Machine Learning for Sustainable and Resilient Agriculture
item.description: Big streams of Earth images from satellites or other platforms (e. g., drones and mobile phones) are becoming increasingly available at low or no cost and with enhanced spatial and temporal resolution.

item.title: Multi-task Learning for Camera Calibration
item.description: As far as we are aware, our approach is the first one that uses an approach to multi-task learning that includes mathematical formulas in a framework for learning to estimate camera parameters to predict both the extrinsic and intrinsic parameters jointly.

item.title: On the Transferability of Visual Features in Generalized Zero-Shot Learning
item.description: Generalized Zero-Shot Learning (GZSL) aims to train a classifier that can generalize to unseen classes, using a set of attributes as auxiliary information, and the visual features extracted from a pre-trained convolutional neural network.

item.title: A Novel Center-based Deep Contrastive Metric Learning Method for the Detection of Polymicrogyria in Pediatric Brain MRI
item.description: We propose an anomaly detection method based on a novel center-based deep contrastive metric learning loss function (cDCM) which enables the automatic detection of cases of potential PMG.

item.title: Program of Thoughts Prompting: Disentangling Computation from Reasoning for Numerical Reasoning Tasks
item.description: By combining PoT with self-consistency decoding, we can achieve SoTA performance on all math problem datasets and near-SoTA performance on financial datasets.

item.title: Ontology-aware Learning and Evaluation for Audio Tagging
item.description: The proposed metric, ontology-aware mean average precision (OmAP) addresses the weaknesses of mAP by utilizing the AudioSet ontology information during the evaluation.

item.title: Person Image Synthesis via Denoising Diffusion Model
item.description: In this work, we show how denoising diffusion models can be applied for high-fidelity person image synthesis with strong sample diversity and enhanced mode coverage of the learnt data distribution.
